com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec

Interface DecodeIterator


  • public interface DecodeIterator
    An iterator for decoding the RWF content.

    All RWF decoding requires the use of a DecodeIterator, where a single iterator can manage the full decoding process. For instance, if the application is decoding a message containing a FieldList, the same DecodeIterator can be used to decode the FieldList, all FieldEntry, and all types (primitive types or container types) housed in the entries. Separate iterators can be used as well, depending on the needs of the application. Following the same example, one DecodeIterator can be used to decode the message information (up to the beginning of the FieldList payload). Another DecodeIterator reference can be used to decode the FieldList and entries, and if desired, other iterators can be used to decode the contents of each FieldEntry.

    Before decoding begins, the iterator should be initialized to ready it for decoding. Initialization consists of several steps. The clear() method can be used to initialize (or re-initialize for reuse) the DecodeIterator. After clearing, a Buffer containing the content to decode should be associated with the DecodeIterator. In addition, RWF version information should be provided to the DecodeIterator so the desired version of RWF is decoded.

    Decode Iterator Example

    The following code example demonstrates creation of the UPA decode iterator, associating buffer to decode and setting RWF version to the decode iterator: 

    •  //Create DecodeIterator using CodecFactory
 DecodeIterator decIter = CodecFactory.createDecodeIterator()}; 
 
 //Clear iterator 
 clear();
 
 //Associate buffer to decode with the iterator and set RWF version on the iterator 
 if (decIter.setBufferAndRWFVersion(decBuffer, 
                            Codec.majorVersion(), 
                            Codec.minorVersion()) < CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS) 
 { 
      //Handle error appropriately 
      return 0; 
 }
 
 //do decoding using iterator

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears DecodeIterator, defaults to use current version of RWF. After clearing an iterator, the buffer needs to be set using setBufferAndRWFVersion(Buffer, int, int)
        Note:
        This should be used to achieve the best performance while clearing the iterator

      • setBufferAndRWFVersion

        int setBufferAndRWFVersion(Buffer buffer,
                           int rwfMajorVersion,
                           int rwfMinorVersion)
        Sets the Decode iterator's buffer and the desired RWF Version on the iterator. When used for decoding, the iterator will then use that version of the RWF to Decode.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to use for decoding
        rwfMajorVersion - - this is the major version of the wire format to Decode
        rwfMinorVersion - - this is the minor version of the wire format to Decode
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if Buffer is successfully associated with iterator and RWF version is set, CodecReturnCodes.VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED if version is invalid, CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if invalid buffer length or buffer data.
        See Also:
        Buffer

      • setBufferAndRWFVersion

        int setBufferAndRWFVersion(TransportBuffer buffer,
                           int rwfMajorVersion,
                           int rwfMinorVersion)
        Sets the Decode iterator's buffer and the desired RWF Version on the iterator. When used for decoding, the iterator will then use that version of the RWF to Decode.
        Parameters:
        buffer - Buffer to use for decoding
        rwfMajorVersion - - this is the major version of the wire format to Decode
        rwfMinorVersion - - this is the minor version of the wire format to Decode
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if TransportBuffer is successfully associated with iterator and RWF version is set, CodecReturnCodes.VERSION_NOT_SUPPORTED if version is invalid, CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if invalid buffer length or buffer data.
        See Also:
        TransportBuffer

      • setGlobalFieldSetDefDb

        int setGlobalFieldSetDefDb(GlobalFieldSetDefDb setDefDb)
        Sets the Global Field Set Definition Database on the iterator. When used for decoding, the iterator will use that database to decode any field lists that contain set definitions.
        Parameters:
        setDefDb - - this is the database that will be used for decoding.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if GlobalFieldSetDefDb is successfully set on the iterator.
        See Also:
        TransportBuffer

      • setGlobalElementSetDefDb

        int setGlobalElementSetDefDb(GlobalElementSetDefDb setDefDb)
        Sets the Global Element Set Definition Database on the iterator. When used for decoding, the iterator will use that database to decode any field lists that contain set definitions.
        Parameters:
        setDefDb - - this is the database that will be used for decoding.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if GlobalElementSetDefDb is successfully set on the iterator.
        See Also:
        TransportBuffer

      • finishDecodeEntries

        int finishDecodeEntries()
        Finishes decoding of a container. Once a user begins decoding a container, typically they must decode all entries in that container before continuing.This method may be used instead to skip straight to the end.
        Typical use:
        1. Call the appropriate container decoder(e.g. FieldList.decode(DecodeIterator, LocalFieldSetDefDb)).
        2. Call the entry decoder until the desired entry is found (e.g. a FieldEntry with a particular ID).
        3. Call finishDecodeEntries() to complete decoding the container.
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.END_OF_CONTAINER when successful, other non-success code from CodecReturnCodes if not.

      • majorVersion

        int majorVersion()
        Major version number of the decode iterator. Valid only after setBufferAndRWFVersion(Buffer, int, int) call.
        Returns:
        Decode iterator major version when valid or CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE when invalid.

      • minorVersion

        int minorVersion()
        Minor version number of the decode iterator. Valid only after setBufferAndRWFVersion(Buffer, int, int) call.
        Returns:
        Decode iterator minor version when valid or CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE when invalid.

      • extractMsgClass

        int extractMsgClass()
        Extract msgClass from the UPA message encoded in the buffer.
        Returns:
        msgClass or CodecReturnCodes.INCOMPLETE_DATA if the encoded buffer is too small
        See Also:
        MsgClasses

      • extractDomainType

        int extractDomainType()
        Extract domainType from the UPA message encoded in the buffer.
        Returns:
        domainType or CodecReturnCodes.INCOMPLETE_DATA if the encoded buffer is too small
        See Also:
        DomainTypes

      • extractStreamId

        int extractStreamId()
        Extract streamId from the UPA message encoded in the buffer.
        Returns:
        streamId or CodecReturnCodes.INCOMPLETE_DATA if the encoded buffer is too small

      • extractSeqNum

        int extractSeqNum()
        Extract seqNum from the UPA message encoded in the buffer.
        Returns:
        seqNum or CodecReturnCodes.INCOMPLETE_DATA if the encoded buffer is too small

      • extractGroupId

        int extractGroupId(Buffer groupId)
        Extract groupId from the UPA message encoded in the buffer.
        Parameters:
        groupId - the Buffer to extract groupId into
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS, if groupId is populated in the groupId, CodecReturnCodes.FAILURE if groupId not available, CodecReturnCodes.INCOMPLETE_DATA if the encoded buffer is too small; CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if the groupId buffer is too small

      • extractPostId

        int extractPostId()
        Extract postId from the UPA message encoded in the buffer.
        Returns:
        seqNum or CodecReturnCodes.INCOMPLETE_DATA if the encoded buffer is too small
